incidents.name: CloudHub | January 2024 Runtime and DLB Monthly Patches were not Applied in US Control Plane Automatically

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix/resolution is in the works.

We are investigating an issue affecting CloudHub Monthly Auto-upgrade, we will provide more information as soon as we can.   

Affected Customers are directed to follow the below link - Article Link https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/CloudHub-January-2024-Runtime-and-DLB-Monthly-Patches-were-not-Applied-in-US-Control-Plane-Automatically

incidents.name: Environments are Erroring Upon Delete

incident_updates.body: As of 14:20 PT (22:20 UTC) the issue has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Customers will experience an error when attempting to delete an environment. Teams are investigating this issue.

incidents.name: New Templates Unable to be Deployed to Partner Manager

incident_updates.body:
The recent issues affecting Partner Manager customers on CloudHub have been successfully resolved. Our teams have addressed the problems that were causing failures in the deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades. We also resolved the difficulties impacting transaction replays.

Please note that runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows were not impacted during this issue.

We appreciate your patience and understanding while we worked to fix these issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Deployment of new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using CloudHub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix. This issue also impacts the ability to replay transactions. Runtime applications and data processing of already deployed message flows are not impacted due to this issue.
Deploying new message flows and running template upgrades are failing for Partner Manager customers using Cloudhub. Teams have identified the issue are are working on a fix.

components.name: Anypoint Partner Manager v2
components.description: Anypoint Partner Manager v2 accelerates customer adoption of B2B integrations by enabling easy configuration and management of their B2B flows

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with Composer creating new or opening and modifying existing flows.

incident_updates.body: As of 10:56 PM UTC the incident was mitigated the issue has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
Customers may experience problems when they attempt to create a new flow or open/edit an existing flow in the Composer user interface.  There is no impact to running flows.

incidents.name: API Analytics Data Delayed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are still working on implementing a fix, we will provide more information soon
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
The API Analytics data may not be showing real-time information for some customers; there is a delay in the data display. Teams are currently investigating.

incidents.name: Issue with usage reports in CloudHub 2.0

incident_updates.body: Customers running Mule apps on CloudHub 2.0 who are monitoring usage in the usage reports may observe missing Network Bytes data from September 2023 onward

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with MS Anypoint Monitoring

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Anypoint Monitoring for Flex Gateway logs delays in US region - Thursday, January 21, 2024_](http://Anypoint)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.
Engineers have identified the cause of the issue and are working towards implementing a fix.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Customers may experience problems with MS Anypoint Monitoring. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: OpenShift RTF Cert Renewal Issues.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The issue has been mitigated and can be fixed by following the below KB:

https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Runtime-Fabric-Cluster-is-Disconnected-or-Degraded-and-Showing-remote-error-tls-unknown-certificate
Customers may experience OpenShift RTF Cert renewal issues; teams are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Errors in CloudHub

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customer applications were unable to deploy or start on schedule in the US Region - Thursday, January 18, 2024_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customer-applications-were-unable-to-deploy-or-start-on-schedule-in-the-US-Region-Thursday-January-18-2024)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

Some customers may experience issues with CloudHub applications when:
- managing application schedules
- deploying/redeploying applications

A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results
We are currently investigating the issue

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with MuleSoft Composer

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Customers may experience problems when trying to create/edit/run flows while using MuleSoft Composer. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Customers may experience missing usage metrics from API Designer products in Anypoint Exchange

incident_updates.body: This issue was resolved at 14:46 PT, after a fix was successfully deployed and validated.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We detected an issue on Anypoint Exchange and API Designer products concerning usage metrics which we're investigating. No impact is expected for customers as of now. A delayed impact may be experienced for some customers, specifically some API Designer usage metrics may not show up in your Exchange dashboards.

incidents.name: Issues with the Secrets Manager UI

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: API Analytic alerts may not work for newly created alerts.

incident_updates.body: As of 4:55 pm PT when incident was mitigated, the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
We are investigating an issue in which some customers may experience delay in receiving new API alerts.

incidents.name: Issues with API Commmunity Manager

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incident_updates.body: The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: Exchange experiencing 500 errors and random slowness.

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customers experienced “500” errors or latency for Exchange in the US Region - January 03, 2024_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customers-experienced-500-errors-or-latency-for-Exchange-in-the-US-Region-January-03-2024) _- Final_

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Engineers are still working on the issue as it is intermittent.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are investigating an issue on which some Exchange customers are experiencing 504, 500 errors and random slowness when fetching assets from Exchange, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

incidents.name: Some Object Store v2 Customers in SA-East-1 Region experienced HTTP 400 errors.

incident_updates.body: On Tuesday at 18:55 PT some customers experienced an issue while attempting to access Object Store v2 (SA-East-1 Region), Engineering teams fixed the problem/issue at 20:57 PT

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Service - sa-east-1

incidents.name: MuleSoft Access Management Custom Audit Log screen producing errors

incident_updates.body: As of 15:17 PT the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
Customers will experience errors while using the Audit Log custom filter function on the Access Management UI. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Backlog in API Analytics events

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: API Manager is intermittently not loading in US-Prod.

incident_updates.body: Starting at 11:10 AM PT (7:10 PM UTC) some customers experienced an issue while attempting to access API Manager, Engineering teams fix the problem ended the issue at 11:26 AM PT (7:26 PM UTC).
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are investigating an issue where some customers are experiencing un-expected error (Bad Gateway) while attempting to access API Manager hence it is not loading. Engineers are actively working on the issue, and we will provide more information as soon as we can.

incidents.name: Issue creating new Server Groups or Server Clusters

incident_updates.body: As of 04:11 Pacific Time the issue has been resolved and Server Groups and Server Clusters can be created normally. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

Customers will experience issues creating new Server Groups or Server Clusters while using Runtime Manager. Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are working towards resolution. Currently running Runtimes, Server Groups or Server Clusters are functioning normally.
We are investigating an issue in Anypoint Runtime Manager. Customers may not be able to create new Server Groups or Server Clusters.

incidents.name: Activation Failure for New Composer Flows

incident_updates.body: As of 02:06 PT the issue has been resolved and all Composer flows are activating normally. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.

We have identified the root cause of the issue where new Composer Flows are not activating properly. We are now working diligently to resolve this problem. We appreciate your continued patience and understanding as we work towards a fix.

We are currently experiencing an issue where new Composer Flows are not activating as expected. Users attempting to activate a new flow are finding that instead of the flow transitioning to an active status, it reverts back to edit mode. Our team is aware of this problem and is actively working to diagnose and resolve it. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your patience while we work on a fix.

incidents.name: Customers [may/will] experience problems with CloudHub 2.0 management of Private Spaces

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The fix is being deployed now across all environments, we will update the site as soon as the rollout is complete.

Customers who have inherited permissions will find that they are not working as expected. If you have a user who is unable to see CloudHub 2.0 private spaces and their configurations because of inherited permissions, an organization administrator can assign the permission directly to the user.

The permissions impacted are:
* Organization Administrator
* CloudHub Network Viewer
* CloudHub Network Administrator

The engineering team is working on rolling back the change that has impacted inherited permissions.

incidents.name: Runtime Manager possible delay in receiving Monitoring Alerts.

incident_updates.body:
We investigated an issue on which some customers might have experienced not getting some alerts or delay in getting alerts on Runtime Manager.

As of 10:16 PT We have resolved the issue, customers are no longer experiencing any issues with not getting alerts or delay in alerts.

incidents.name: Runtime Fabric UI issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Some customers may be experiencing UI issues for Runtime Fabric, where some elements are not loading correctly.

incidents.name: Some Customers are experiencing Issues while attempting to Deploy Apps to RTF.

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customers were unable to deploy new applications to Runtime Fabric - Thursday, November 09, 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customers-were-unable-to-deploy-new-applications-to-Runtime-Fabric-Thursday-November-09-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
As of 14:45 PM PT We have resolved the issue, customers will not experience problems while attempting to deploy Apps to RTF.
We have been able to successfully reproduce the issue and we are actively working towards mitigation.
We are investigating an issue on which customers will experience problems while attempting to deploying Apps to RTF, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

incidents.name: Customers will experience problems with Mule Runtime

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

This incident has been resolved.

Customers will experience issues while using the Mule August Patch 3.9.5 on Cloudhub. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Some Customers may experience issues with CloudHub 2.0 Clustered Apps.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

CloudHub 2.0 applications with 2 or more replicas in a clustered mode may fail to start/deploy/redeploy.
The engineering team is aware of the issue and are working on the fix. Please consider using the mitigation measures explained in this article (https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Application-deployment-with-runtime-cluster-mode-set-to-ON-but-fails-with-argument-content-is-null).

We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

incidents.name: API Historical Analytic Data Delayed Post US Release

incident_updates.body:
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_API Analytics historical data may not be available - June 24th 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/API-Analytics-historical-data-may-not-be-available-June-24th-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This issue has been resolved. The migration of historical data migration for API Analytics has completed and is now viewable.

Historical data migration related to today's US release for API Analytics is still going on and taking longer than expected. Customers searching for historical data related to application analytics may see empty values. Real-time data is available, and is not impacted. We expect the migration to complete in 2 to 4 hours.

Historical data migration related to today's US release for API Analytics is taking longer than expected. Customers searching for historical data related to application analytics may see empty values. Real-time data is available, and is not impacted. We expect the migration to complete in 4 to 6 hours.

incidents.name: AKS and RTF Interoperability issue

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Customer may have been unable to restart applications after upgrading Kubernetes on Microsoft AKS to v1.25 - May 26th 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Customer-may-have-been-unable-to-restart-applications-after-upgrading-Kubernetes-on-Microsoft-AKS-to-v1-25-May-26th-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
The new images are now available.

RTF customers running Mule workloads on self-managed Azure (AKS) platforms are advised to not upgrade their kubernetes infrastructure to version k8s1.25 due to a known cgroupsv2 interoperability issue with JDK8 used in the Runtimes. We will notify when a Mule Runtime update with the appropriate patch for this interoperability issue is available.

incidents.name: Shared spaces issue with CloudHub2.0 in us-east-2

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_CloudHub 2.0 US East \(Ohio\) Shared space unavailable in the US region - May 25 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/CloudHub-2-0-US-East-Ohio-Shared-space-unavailable-in-the-US-region-May-25-2023)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._

As of 12:00 PM PT we are declared this issue as resolved, we reiterate our commitment to our customers and will be providing an RCA via our Help center in the next days.

Once more, we appreciate your patience.

We finished processing all data and all CloudHub 2.0 applications in the  us-east-2(Ohio) region should be fully operational, if you are experiencing problems feel free to reach out to support.

Once more we appreciate your patience during this issue.

A high percentage of applications are back online for CloudHub 2.0 customers in the us-east-2(Ohio) region, our internal systems are processing all the data to complete this task, we appreciate your patience while we work to fully restore the applications.

The process to bring back applications is still working, CloudHub 2.0 customers with applications in the us-east-2 (Ohio) region will see more applications coming back online, we are actively working towards fully resolution.

Thanks for your patience.

More applications are coming back online, CloudHub 2.0 customers with applications in the shared space us-east-2 (Ohio) will see recoveries, we are still working on making sure all applications are back online.

Thank you for patience while we continue working on this issue.

Some customers will start seeing their CloudHub 2.0 applications coming back online, we are verifying all deployments and progressing on making available all impacted applications.
This issue only impacted the CloudHub 2.0 shared space in the us-east-2 (Ohio) region.

Thank you for your patience while we continue working on restoring the applications.

While we continue working on redeploying the inaccessible applications we are doing validations, this is adding some extra time at the top of the redeployments, we will send a new update in the next 2 hours.

We appreciate your patience while we work on restoring the affected applications

We are now redeploying the inaccessible applications in order to return them to their normal operating state.  This is a time consuming process and will continue for some time, we will post another update in approximately 2 hours.

We continue to work diligently to restore all of the inaccessible applications to their normal operating state.

Thank you

We have made a proactive communication via email to potentially impacted users.

Our team is continuing to work diligently and have a path to return the remaining inaccessible applications to their normal operating state.

Thank you for your support while we continue to address this issue.

The inaccessible applications have been fully identified and data has been restored, we are now in the process of building out and relaunching the inaccessible applications.  This will take sometime and we will update you on our progress in approximately one hour.

Thank you again for your patience as we get the inaccessible applications back to their normal operational state.

As we continue our ongoing efforts to restore the us-east-2(Ohio), we want to call out that our suggested work-around does require that you understand your applications behavior.  We are working to return the currently inaccessible apps to their working state.  Once this is done, if you have launched your app in another region both applications may be running at the same time.  The impact of this can only be evaluated by your staff.  Please take this into consideration going forward.

In our previous update where we referenced creating a support case, if warranted by your business impact please make that an S1 case.

We appreciate your patience as we continue to work to restore the inaccessible applications

We are continuing our efforts to return the inaccessible applications to their normal operating state. If you are impacted and a Titanium or Platinum customer with global deployment you can deploy your applications to another region, if your architecture allows it. For Gold customers if your business is impacted you will need to create a support case referencing incident-52198963 and our support staff will work to change your default region to a workable option for you.

Thank you for your patience as our staff continues their work.

The issue with the CloudHub 2.0 shared space in the us-east-2 (Ohio) region has been identified. Unfortunately, a subset of customer applications is currently inaccessible. Rest assured, we are actively working on resolving the issue and bringing the impacted applications back to their normal operating state.
We are currently investigating an issue with CH2.0 shared spaces in us-east-2

incidents.name: Mule runtime from April causing some issues

incident_updates.body: The new Mule Runtime release for May addresses the performance problems that were identified in the April release, customers can safely adopt the newer May release. If you need further assistance, please submit a ticket via our Help Center

MuleSoft engineering is working on an issue related with the April release of our Mule Runtime, if you are running the April Mule Runtime release and you are experiencing issues, please follow the workaround provided here  [Requires login]:
https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Degraded-Performance-in-CloudHub-Resource-Intensive-Applications-Utilizing-the-April-2023-Runtime-Release  
We are working on a permanent solution to this issue.

incidents.name: Anypoint Platform Release and Maintenance Window Extended

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_Mulesoft Composer and Mulesoft Composer for Salesforce Extended Release Window for US - 21st Jan 2023_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/Mulesoft-Composer-and-Mulesoft-Composer-for-Salesforce-Extended-Release-Window-for-US)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

The widow for the US Anypoint Platform release has been extended. The following services will be impacted: *** Service Impact Details: ** Applications: Mulesoft Composer and Mulesoft Composer for Salesforce During Maintenance Downtime: * User Experience(UX): Composer UI will remain accessible, Composer customers will not be able to activate new flows, existing flows will be paused for time of infrastructure upgrade and may be inaccessible (showing "Activating" or "Deactivating" in UI) during maintenance window. Some flows will be impacted with temporary connectivity issues that will be restored after the maintenance window is closed. All flows will resume normal operations, however the failures will be reported in flow Run History for time of maintenance. If you subscribed for error notifications you may receive emails about failures that can be safely ignored if received during the maintenance window.

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
We have resolved the issue. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
Anypoint MQ is back online. We are investigating the consequences of the service outage and monitoring recovery.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
MuleSoft engineering is working on a problem on Anypoint MQ impacting only the ap-southeast-1 Singapore region, customers might experience errors on this region

incidents.name: US Anypoint Platform 50x errors

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_    
We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible.

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/US-Anypoint-Platform-providing-5xx-errors-13-Dec-2022_](https://help.mulesoft.com/s/article/US-Anypoint-Platform-providing-5xx-errors-13-Dec-2022)  
_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
We have resolved the issue. We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
